Comment: Elon Musk’s retreat should ~~relieve~~ fool no one.
Author: 2a_lib

Comment: From Paul Waldman, journalist and author:  “We’re not on the ragged edge of death, not even close,” Tesla CEO Elon Musk told investors on Tuesday’s earnings call. Those are not the words of a leader whose business is doing well, and the first-quarter numbers were indeed bad: In the first quarter of the year, Tesla’s profits fell 71% from the same period a year ago, driven by a sharp drop in sales.  Perhaps in reaction to those numbers — and Tesla’s stock declining more than a third in the same period — Musk told investors that he’ll soon step back from his role overseeing the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE). But whether you’re a Tesla shareholder or just someone who relies on the federal government — which includes all of us — there’s little reason to be reassured.  Read more: [https://www.msnbc.com/opinion/msnbc-opinion/elon-musk-doge-trump-administration-tesla-earnings-rcna202574](https://www.msnbc.com/opinion/msnbc-opinion/elon-musk-doge-trump-administration-tesla-earnings-rcna202574)
